00001 #ifndef SM_COREDATA_EXPORT_MACRO_H
00002 #define SM_COREDATA_EXPORT_MACRO_H
00004 #if defined(SM_COREDATA_BUILD_DLL)
00005 #elif defined(SM_COREDATA_BUILD_LIB)
00006 #elif defined(SM_COREDATA_USE_DLL)
00007 #elif defined(SM_COREDATA_USE_LIB)
00008 #else
00009 // If not defined default to shared library
00010 #       define SM_COREDATA_USE_DLL
00011 #endif
00012 
00013 #ifdef COREDATA_CC_MSVC
00014 // The following ifdef block is the standard way of creating macros which make exporting 
00015 // from a DLL simpler. All files within this DLL are compiled with the SM_COREDATA_EXPORTS
00016 // symbol defined on the command line. this symbol should not be defined on any project
00017 // that uses this DLL. This way any other project whose source files include this file see 
00018 // SM_COREDATA_API functions as being imported from a DLL, whereas this DLL sees symbols
00019 // defined with this macro as being exported.
00020 #   if defined(SM_COREDATA_BUILD_DLL)
00021 #       define SM_COREDATA_API __declspec(dllexport)
00022 #   elif defined(SM_COREDATA_USE_DLL)
00023 #       define SM_COREDATA_API __declspec(dllimport)
00024 #   else
00025 #       define SM_COREDATA_API 
00026 #   endif
00027 
00028 #else
00029 // For gcc
00030 #   if defined(SM_COREDATA_BUILD_DLL) || defined(SM_COREDATA_USE_DLL)
00031 #   define SM_COREDATA_API __attribute__ ((visibility ("default")))
00032 #   else
00033 #   define SM_COREDATA_API 
00034 #   endif
00035 #endif
00036 
00037 
00038 #endif
00039
